structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.text: The appointed members of the State Board of Medical Licensure shall hold office for terms of four (4) years and until their successors are appointed and qualify. The commissioner of public health and the deans of the medical schools shall hold office only while holding their respective titles. The terms of all appointed members of the board shall expire on August 31 of the last year of their respective terms.
law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 130, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2002. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 536, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 302, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1986. -- Created 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 218, sec. 2.
